verses.kjv: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth, may Israel now say:
verses.ct: "They have oppressed me over and over since I was young" — let Israel say this:

verses.kjv: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth: yet they have not prevailed against me.
verses.ct: "They have oppressed me over and over since I was young, but they have never defeated me."

verses.kjv: The plowers plowed upon my back: they made long their furrows.
verses.ct: They dug into my back like farmers plowing a field, cutting long, deep wounds.

verses.kjv: The LORD is righteous: he hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.
verses.ct: The LORD is righteous — he has broken the chains that the wicked used to hold me.

verses.kjv: Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Zion.
verses.ct: May everyone who hates Zion be humiliated and driven away.

verses.kjv: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth afore it groweth up:
verses.ct: May they be like grass growing on a rooftop that dries up before it can even sprout fully —

verses.kjv: Wherewith the mower filleth not his hand; nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom.
verses.ct: so worthless that no harvester bothers to grab it, and no one gathers it into bundles.

verses.kjv: Neither do they which go by say, The blessing of the LORD be upon you: we bless you in the name of the LORD.
verses.ct: And no one passing by will say to them, "May the LORD's blessing rest on you; we bless you in the name of the LORD."
